verses.text_plain: Righteous art thou, O Lord, when I plead with thee: yet let me talk with thee of thy judgments: Wherefore doth the way of the wicked prosper? wherefore are all they happy that deal very treacherously?
verses.verse_html:
1Righteous art thou, O Lord, when I plead with thee: yet let me talk with thee of thy judgments: Wherefore doth the way of the wicked prosper? wherefore are all they happy that deal very treacherously? ▼
▼ talk…: or, reason the case with thee

tokens.text: with thee: yet let me talk

footnotes.body_text: ▼ talk…: or, reason the case with thee
footnotes.body_html: ▼ talk…: or, reason the case with thee

verses.text_plain: Thou hast planted them, yea, they have taken root: they grow, yea, they bring forth fruit: thou art near in their mouth, and far from their reins.
verses.verse_html:
2Thou hast planted them, yea, they have taken root: they grow, yea, they bring forth fruit: thou art near in their mouth, and far from their reins. ▼
▼ they grow: Heb. they go on

tokens.text: them, yea, they have taken root

footnotes.body_text: ▼ they grow: Heb. they go on
footnotes.body_html: ▼ they grow: Heb. they go on

verses.text_plain: But thou, O Lord, knowest me: thou hast seen me, and tried mine heart toward thee: pull them out like sheep for the slaughter, and prepare them for the day of slaughter.
verses.verse_html:
3But thou, O Lord, knowest me: thou hast seen me, and tried mine heart toward thee: pull them out like sheep for the slaughter, and prepare them for the day of slaughter. ▼
▼ toward…: Heb. with thee

footnotes.body_html: ▼ toward…: Heb. with thee

verses.text_plain: How long shall the land mourn, and the herbs of every field wither, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein? the beasts are consumed, and the birds; because they said, He shall not see our last end.
verses.verse_html: 4How long shall the land mourn, and the herbs of every field wither, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein? the beasts are consumed, and the birds; because they said, He shall not see our last end.

verses.text_plain: If thou hast run with the footmen, and they have wearied thee, then how canst thou contend with horses? and if in the land of peace, wherein thou trustedst, they wearied thee, then how wilt thou do in the swelling of Jordan?
verses.verse_html: 5If thou hast run with the footmen, and they have wearied thee, then how canst thou contend with horses? and if in the land of peace, wherein thou trustedst, they wearied thee, then how wilt thou do in the swelling of Jordan?

tokens.text: thee, then how canst thou contend

verses.text_plain: For even thy brethren, and the house of thy father, even they have dealt treacherously with thee; yea, they have called a multitude after thee: believe them not, though they speak fair words unto thee.
verses.verse_html:
6For even thy brethren, and the house of thy father, even they have dealt treacherously with thee; yea, they have called a multitude after thee: believe them not, though they speak fair words unto thee. ▼
▼ they have called…: or, they cried after thee fully
 , ▼
▼ fair…: Heb. good things

tokens.text: with thee; yea, they have called

footnotes.body_text: ▼ they have called…: or, they cried after thee fully
footnotes.body_html: ▼ they have called…: or, they cried after thee fully
▼ fair…: Heb. good things

verses.text_plain: I have forsaken mine house, I have left mine heritage; I have given the dearly beloved of my soul into the hand of her enemies.
verses.verse_html:
7I have forsaken mine house, I have left mine heritage; I have given the dearly beloved of my soul into the hand of her enemies. ▼
▼ the dearly…: Heb. the love

footnotes.body_html: ▼ the dearly…: Heb. the love

verses.text_plain: Mine heritage is unto me as a lion in the forest; it crieth out against me: therefore have I hated it.
verses.verse_html:
8Mine heritage is unto me as a lion in the forest; it crieth out against me: therefore have I hated it. ▼
▼ crieth…: or, yelleth: Heb. giveth out his voice

tokens.text: is unto me as a lion
against me: therefore have I hated

footnotes.body_text: ▼ crieth…: or, yelleth: Heb. giveth out his voice
footnotes.body_html: ▼ crieth…: or, yelleth: Heb. giveth out his voice

verses.text_plain: Mine heritage is unto me as a speckled bird, the birds round about are against her; come ye, assemble all the beasts of the field, come to devour.
verses.verse_html:
9Mine heritage is unto me as a speckled bird, the birds round about are against her; come ye, assemble all the beasts of the field, come to devour. ▼
▼ speckled: or, taloned
 , ▼
▼ come to: or, cause them to come to

footnotes.body_text: ▼ come to: or, cause them to come to
footnotes.body_html: ▼ come to: or, cause them to come to

verses.text_plain: Many pastors have destroyed my vineyard, they have trodden my portion under foot, they have made my pleasant portion a desolate wilderness.
verses.verse_html:
10Many pastors have destroyed my vineyard, they have trodden my portion under foot, they have made my pleasant portion a desolate wilderness. ▼
▼ pleasant…: Heb. portion of desire

footnotes.body_html: ▼ pleasant…: Heb. portion of desire

verses.text_plain: They have made it desolate, and being desolate it mourneth unto me; the whole land is made desolate, because no man layeth it to heart.
verses.verse_html: 11They have made it desolate, and being desolate it mourneth unto me; the whole land is made desolate, because no man layeth it to heart.

verses.text_plain: The spoilers are come upon all high places through the wilderness: for the sword of the Lord shall devour from the one end of the land even to the other end of the land: no flesh shall have peace.
verses.verse_html: 12The spoilers are come upon all high places through the wilderness: for the sword of the Lord shall devour from the one end of the land even to the other end of the land: no flesh shall have peace.

verses.text_plain: They have sown wheat, but shall reap thorns: they have put themselves to pain, but shall not profit: and they shall be ashamed of your revenues because of the fierce anger of the Lord.
verses.verse_html:
13They have sown wheat, but shall reap thorns: they have put themselves to pain, but shall not profit: and they shall be ashamed of your revenues because of the fierce anger of the Lord. ▼
▼ they shall: or, ye shall

tokens.text: they have put themselves to pain

footnotes.body_html: ▼ they shall: or, ye shall

verses.text_plain: Thus saith the Lord against all mine evil neighbours, that touch the inheritance which I have caused my people Israel to inherit; Behold, I will pluck them out of their land, and pluck out the house of Judah from among them.
verses.verse_html: 14Thus saith the Lord against all mine evil neighbours, that touch the inheritance which I have caused my people Israel to inherit; Behold, I will pluck them out of their land, and pluck out the house of Judah from among them.

tokens.text: which I have caused my people
Behold, I will pluck them out

verses.text_plain: And it shall come to pass, after that I have plucked them out I will return, and have compassion on them, and will bring them again, every man to his heritage, and every man to his land.
verses.verse_html: 15And it shall come to pass, after that I have plucked them out I will return, and have compassion on them, and will bring them again, every man to his heritage, and every man to his land.

tokens.text: And it shall come to pass, after
that I have plucked them out
on them, and will bring them again

verses.text_plain: And it shall come to pass, if they will diligently learn the ways of my people, to swear by my name, The Lord liveth; as they taught my people to swear by Baal; then shall they be built in the midst of my people.
verses.verse_html: 16And it shall come to pass, if they will diligently learn the ways of my people, to swear by my name, The Lord liveth; as they taught my people to swear by Baal; then shall they be built in the midst of my people.

tokens.text: And it shall come to pass, if they will diligently

verses.text_plain: But if they will not obey, I will utterly pluck up and destroy that nation, saith the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 17But if they will not obey, I will utterly pluck up and destroy that nation, saith the Lord.

tokens.text: But if they will not obey
